title: How to Open a Storage Unit Door

steps.headline: Unlock the door using a key or code.
steps.description: Most units use a simple cylinder or padlock that requires a key. Insert the key into the keyhole, and turn it until it unlocks. Be sure to remove the lock from the door before opening it. In some units, the doors have more complex locks, like PIN-controlled locks. If you’re not sure how to use the lock, call the storage company, or check the directions for the lock if you purchased it.

steps.headline: Open roll-up doors using the handle at the bottom of the door.
steps.description: Simply pull up on the handle with one or both hands to open the door. Once it rests at the top of the doorway, you can release the handle, and the door will remain rolled up until you need to close it. Most of the time, the door will have a small rope attached to the bottom so that it’s easier to close the door. To close the unit, pull on the rope until you can reach the handle, and then lower the door until the handle touches the ground. Remember to lock the unit after you close the door.

steps.headline: Grasp the handle of the swing door and pull toward you to open the unit.
steps.description: Once the lock is removed from the door, grasp the handle. On some doors, you may need to turn the handle like a normal door to unlatch it, and then pull the door toward you to gain access to the unit. Storage units with swinging doors will always open toward you to prevent crushing or damaging the items inside the unit.

steps.headline: Rotate the locking mechanisms on the right side of the door upward.
steps.description: These locking mechanisms are called “hasps” and can be found on the horizontal bars of the shipping container. Swing the interior hasp into an upward position, and then move right to swing the exterior hasp up as well. Doing this will reveal handles on the door for you to grasp. Large shipping containers might have 3 or more hasps. Be sure to move all of them into the upright position before attempting to open the door.

steps.headline: Grasp the handles and pull them up and toward you to unlatch the door.
steps.description: Place your left and right hand on the 2 handles, and then lift them up to separate them from the hasps. Pull them towards you and to the left to unlatch the door. It might take quite a bit of power to unlatch the door. If you’re having trouble, ask someone for help opening one of the handles while you open the other.

steps.headline: Swing the right door open toward you.
steps.description: When the door is completely unlatched, it should open easily like a standard swinging door. Be careful while opening the door, especially if there are items stored inside of the shipping container. If you have trouble opening the right side door once it is unlatched, double check that the handles are properly disengaged.

steps.headline: Repeat the unlocking process for the left door.
steps.description: Once the right door is open, rotate the hasps and pull the handles to unlatch the left door. Then, swing the door open to gain full access to the shipping container. In some cases, you might be able to access the items in the container without opening both of the doors. In that case, only open the right door. The left door won’t open unless the right door is open because the right door overlaps the left door. If you open the left door first, it will get caught on the right door and won’t open.

steps.headline: Ask a friend to help you open the door for repairs.
steps.description: If the springs on the door are starting to get worn, the door may just be too heavy for you to lift by yourself. Ask a friend to help you open the door, and once it’s open, secure the door in place with a large, sturdy item that won’t collapse under the weight of the door. You can then repair the springs or call someone to repair them. If you’re not experienced with storage unit or roll-up doors, don’t attempt to fix it by yourself. You can get seriously injured or trapped in the unit.

steps.headline: Call the storage company to report a stuck door if you’re renting the unit.
steps.description: For a unit that you don’t own, immediately contact the property manager to let them know that the door is stuck. They will call a repair person to  come and fix the door as soon as possible. Don’t try to open the door on your own if it’s stuck. If you’re unsure of the property owner’s number, visit the main office if there’s one on site or nearby. If not, look up the storage company online and search for a customer service number.

steps.headline: Contact a door repair company to fix the door if you own the unit.
steps.description:
Search for a door repair company in your area that works with roll-up doors, like garage doors. Call them as soon as possible to set up a consultation. The price of the repair will depend on whether or not the springs need replaced and if there is any damage to the metal door slats. Try to be as specific as possible when describing the problem. For example, you might say “My roll-up door on my storage unit won’t open. It doesn’t appear that anything is blocking the door from opening since the unit is only partially filled. When I try to lift it, the door moves only a few inches before it becomes too heavy to lift.”
The more information that they have about the door, the better an estimate they can give you for the cost and time frame of repairs. If you need to remove something from the unit, consider having the repair company remove the door completely so that you can access your items before the door is repaired. Then, the company can replace and repair the door. It will be more expensive, but you will be able to remove your items from the unit.

steps.headline: Refrain from entering the unit until it has been professionally repaired.
steps.description: Even if you can lift the door partially, do not enter the unit or extend your arms or legs under the door. The heavy door can fall and crush your arm or leg, or you can get stuck inside of the unit if the springs fail. If you’ve never repaired a roll-up door before, don’t attempt to do it yourself. The springs can be very difficult to work with, and the doors are extremely heavy.

steps.headline: Contact the storage company to let them know you’re locked out.
steps.description: Some storage companies keep a spare key for each unit to assist people who have been locked out. Call them as soon as you arrive at the unit, and let them know the unit number and type of lock. If your key isn’t working in the lock, it’s possible that the storage company changed the lock, and they will be able to explain why the lock was changed. In most cases, the storage company hasn’t yet received payment for the unit, and wants to make sure that they do.

steps.headline: Call a locksmith if the lock is broken.
steps.description: If the storage unit has confirmed that they received your payment, but don’t have the ability to open the lock, call a locksmith. Explain that you’re locked out and have discussed the issue with the storage company. They will normally be able to diagnose the problem and give you an estimate for fixing the lock. In most cases, the locksmith will be able to fix the lock, as long as they have the permission of the storage company. However, they may need to drill or cut the lock off of the door.

steps.headline: Pay the storage company if the locks have been changed.
steps.description: If you forgot to pay the company, try to make a payment as soon as possible to prevent the storage company from placing a lien on your unit. If you don’t pay within a certain amount of time, they may be able to auction the unit. If you have paid and feel that the lock shouldn’t have been changed, consider contacting a lawyer to get additional advice. Explain the situation thoroughly and ask how you should go about regaining access to your unit.

text:
Using Different Types of Doors Unlock the door using a key or code. Most units use a simple cylinder or padlock that requires a key. Insert the key into the keyhole, and turn it until it unlocks. Be sure to remove the lock from the door before opening it. In some units, the doors have more complex locks, like PIN-controlled locks. If you’re not sure how to use the lock, call the storage company, or check the directions for the lock if you purchased it. Open roll-up doors using the handle at the bottom of the door. Simply pull up on the handle with one or both hands to open the door. Once it rests at the top of the doorway, you can release the handle, and the door will remain rolled up until you need to close it. Most of the time, the door will have a small rope attached to the bottom so that it’s easier to close the door. To close the unit, pull on the rope until you can reach the handle, and then lower the door until the handle touches the ground. Remember to lock the unit after you close the door. Grasp the handle of the swing door and pull toward you to open the unit. Once the lock is removed from the door, grasp the handle. On some doors, you may need to turn the handle like a normal door to unlatch it, and then pull the door toward you to gain access to the unit. Storage units with swinging doors will always open toward you to prevent crushing or damaging the items inside the unit. Opening a Shipping Container Rotate the locking mechanisms on the right side of the door upward. These locking mechanisms are called “hasps” and can be found on the horizontal bars of the shipping container. Swing the interior hasp into an upward position, and then move right to swing the exterior hasp up as well. Doing this will reveal handles on the door for you to grasp. Large shipping containers might have 3 or more hasps. Be sure to move all of them into the upright position before attempting to open the door. Grasp the handles and pull them up and toward you to unlatch the door. Place your left and right hand on the 2 handles, and then lift them up to separate them from the hasps. Pull them towards you and to the left to unlatch the door. It might take quite a bit of power to unlatch the door. If you’re having trouble, ask someone for help opening one of the handles while you open the other. Swing the right door open toward you. When the door is completely unlatched, it should open easily like a standard swinging door. Be careful while opening the door, especially if there are items stored inside of the shipping container. If you have trouble opening the right side door once it is unlatched, double check that the handles are properly disengaged. Repeat the unlocking process for the left door. Once the right door is open, rotate the hasps and pull the handles to unlatch the left door. Then, swing the door open to gain full access to the shipping container. In some cases, you might be able to access the items in the container without opening both of the doors. In that case, only open the right door. The left door won’t open unless the right door is open because the right door overlaps the left door. If you open the left door first, it will get caught on the right door and won’t open. Troubleshooting a Roll-Up Door Ask a friend to help you open the door for repairs. If the springs on the door are starting to get worn, the door may just be too heavy for you to lift by yourself. Ask a friend to help you open the door, and once it’s open, secure the door in place with a large, sturdy item that won’t collapse under the weight of the door. You can then repair the springs or call someone to repair them. If you’re not experienced with storage unit or roll-up doors, don’t attempt to fix it by yourself. You can get seriously injured or trapped in the unit. Call the storage company to report a stuck door if you’re renting the unit. For a unit that you don’t own, immediately contact the property manager to let them know that the door is stuck. They will call a repair person to  come and fix the door as soon as possible. Don’t try to open the door on your own if it’s stuck. If you’re unsure of the property owner’s number, visit the main office if there’s one on site or nearby. If not, look up the storage company online and search for a customer service number. Contact a door repair company to fix the door if you own the unit. Search for a door repair company in your area that works with roll-up doors, like garage doors. Call them as soon as possible to set up a consultation. The price of the repair will depend on whether or not the springs need replaced and if there is any damage to the metal door slats. Try to be as specific as possible when describing the problem. For example, you might say “My roll-up door on my storage unit won’t open. It doesn’t appear that anything is blocking the door from opening since the unit is only partially filled. When I try to lift it, the door moves only a few inches before it becomes too heavy to lift.”
The more information that they have about the door, the better an estimate they can give you for the cost and time frame of repairs. If you need to remove something from the unit, consider having the repair company remove the door completely so that you can access your items before the door is repaired. Then, the company can replace and repair the door. It will be more expensive, but you will be able to remove your items from the unit. Refrain from entering the unit until it has been professionally repaired. Even if you can lift the door partially, do not enter the unit or extend your arms or legs under the door. The heavy door can fall and crush your arm or leg, or you can get stuck inside of the unit if the springs fail. If you’ve never repaired a roll-up door before, don’t attempt to do it yourself. The springs can be very difficult to work with, and the doors are extremely heavy. Fixing a Malfunctioning Lock Contact the storage company to let them know you’re locked out. Some storage companies keep a spare key for each unit to assist people who have been locked out. Call them as soon as you arrive at the unit, and let them know the unit number and type of lock. If your key isn’t working in the lock, it’s possible that the storage company changed the lock, and they will be able to explain why the lock was changed. In most cases, the storage company hasn’t yet received payment for the unit, and wants to make sure that they do. Call a locksmith if the lock is broken. If the storage unit has confirmed that they received your payment, but don’t have the ability to open the lock, call a locksmith. Explain that you’re locked out and have discussed the issue with the storage company. They will normally be able to diagnose the problem and give you an estimate for fixing the lock. In most cases, the locksmith will be able to fix the lock, as long as they have the permission of the storage company. However, they may need to drill or cut the lock off of the door. Pay the storage company if the locks have been changed. If you forgot to pay the company, try to make a payment as soon as possible to prevent the storage company from placing a lien on your unit. If you don’t pay within a certain amount of time, they may be able to auction the unit. If you have paid and feel that the lock shouldn’t have been changed, consider contacting a lawyer to get additional advice. Explain the situation thoroughly and ask how you should go about regaining access to your unit.
